        public long getWaitTime()

      • hardReset

        @ManagedOperation
public void hardReset()
        The hard reset causes the scheduler loop to restart ignoring all current executing requests. Upon reset the counts of executing requests and the status of all jobs will be updated to ensure consistency.

      • pause

        @ManagedOperation
public void pause()
        The pause causes the scheduler to sleep until a soft or hard reset is initiated.

      • postRun

        protected void postRun()

      • setWaitTime

        public void setWaitTime(long waitTime)

      • softReset

        @ManagedOperation
public void softReset()
        The soft reset causes the scheduler loop to restart after all current executing requests have completed. Upon reset the counts of executing requests and the status of all jobs will be updated to ensure consistency.
